texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: To pretty much completely disable SSH timeouts, simply adjust the following directives in /etc/ssh/sshd_config:
texts.text: To pretty much completely disable SSH timeouts, simply adjust the following directives in /etc/ssh/sshd_config:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: EDIT:  Once that's changed, be sure to restart your ssh daemon.
texts.text: EDIT:  Once that's changed, be sure to restart your ssh daemon.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: SECURITY WARNING:  If you remove users from your system, but they're still connected via ssh, their connection may remain open indefinitely. Be sure to check all active ssh sessions after adjusting a user's access.
texts.text: SECURITY WARNING:  If you remove users from your system, but they're still connected via ssh, their connection may remain open indefinitely. Be sure to check all active ssh sessions after adjusting a user's access.
